thread.title: The never-give-up spirit of Finley coll at his school sports day will melt your heart |
thread.title_full: The never-give-up spirit of Finley coll at his school sports day will melt your heart | The Courier-Mail

author: couriermail.com.au
title: The never-give-up spirit of Finley coll at his school sports day will melt your heart |
text:
The Sunshine Coast boy was diagnosed with quadriplegic cerebral palsy at a few months old and his mother Amanda, was told that he would never crawl, walk or speak.
Well, take a look at him now as he races to the finish line supported by his entire school.
He might trip up here and there but nothing stops the little fighter as the navigates the bumpy surface with his walking aid.
The look of sheer joy on his face is worth a gold medal.
Finley confidently gets around with his wheelchair or walker and can even take a few unaided steps across his trampoline. Incredibly, he can also speak using a specially designed electronic device.
Finley Coll. Source: CourierMail
According to Amanda, it has taken countless hours of speech therapy and expensive communication devices, as well as the assistance of Teacher’s Aids and herself interpreting words and gestures, for Finley to communicate his basic needs and emotions.
However, with the help of local disability support organisation the Cerebral Palsy League, Finley is now learning how to tell his family and friends his true thoughts and feelings using a new device called the Liberator
“The big goal is for him to have independent speech: it really is the most important ability,” his mum said.
“He’s very bright and has a fabulous sense of humour; he adores music and singing, and he’d love to be a DJ. He thinks he might even be an engineer so he can be his Dad’s boss. He wants to be involved in everything. He doesn’t let his disability stop him at all,” Amanda said.
You are a true champion Finley.
